text: Helen Brooke Taussig (May 24, 1898 â€“ May 20, 1986) was an American cardiologist. Her work focused on pediatric cardiology. She is known for creating the lifesaving surgery that would make children born with Tetralogy of Fallot (the most common cause of blue baby syndrome) live longer. ==References== Category:1898 births Category:1986 deaths Category:Road accident deaths in the United States Category:American physicians Category:Cardiologists Category:Scientists from Massachusetts Category:People from Cambridge, Massachusetts Category:Presidential Medal of Freedom recipients
title: Helen B. Taussig
